meanings.definition: The quality of being attracted to water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophilicity of the sponge made it absorb water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophilicity of the soil allowed the plants to thrive.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophilicity of the umbrella was so high that it started dripping water on its own!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a hydrophilicity that drew people towards her like water to a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophilicity of the paper towel was so strong that it soaked up the spill in seconds.

meanings.definition: The ability to interact with or dissolve in water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophilicity of the salt caused it to dissolve quickly in the water.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophilicity of the sugar made it easy to mix into the drink.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophilicity of the crayon was so high that it melted in the rain!
meanings.sent4: His words had a hydrophilicity that blended seamlessly with the emotions in the room.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophilicity of the detergent was evident as it effortlessly dissolved in the washing machine.
